skill.name: compound-docs
skill.description: Capture solved problems as searchable documentation with pattern detection. This skill auto-triggers when users confirm a fix worked ("that worked", "it's fixed", "working now") or manually via /compound command.
skill.summary: Capture solved problems as searchable documentation with pattern detection. This skill auto-triggers...
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, no network access, and no sensitive capabilities. The skill contains only markdown documentation and a YAML schema file. All described functionality (reading schema.yaml, creating markdown files, searching with grep) is directly aligned with its documented purpose of creating searchable solution documentation.

content.value_statement: Repeated problems waste team time. This skill captures fixes automatically when you confirm something works, turning solved issues into searchable documentation. Patterns are detected across occurrences for faster future resolution.
actual_capabilities: Auto-triggers when users confirm fixes worked (phrase detection)
Extracts problem context from conversation for documentation
Creates standardized markdown solution files with frontmatter
Searches existing docs for similar issues before creating new entries
Promotes recurring issues to pattern documentation
Updates schema.yaml with new categories and components
limitations: Does not execute code or modify source files beyond documentation
Requires user confirmation to create documentation
Output directory must be configured by user
Does not integrate with external knowledge bases

use_cases.title: Build team knowledge base
use_cases.description: Automatically document solved issues so your team can find solutions in minutes instead of hours.

use_cases.title: Track deployment patterns
use_cases.description: Capture deployment fixes and recurring issues to build a searchable reference for CI/CD problems.

use_cases.title: Onboard faster
use_cases.description: Create searchable documentation that compounds team knowledge and reduces repeated problem-solving.

prompt_templates.title: Manual Trigger
prompt_templates.prompt: Document this fix with /compound or by saying "that worked"

prompt_templates.title: Check Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Check docs/solutions/patterns.md before making changes to see known issues

prompt_templates.title: Search Solutions
prompt_templates.prompt: Search existing solutions using grep for error message fragments in docs/solutions/

prompt_templates.title: Review Categories
prompt_templates.prompt: What categories are defined in schema.yaml and how should I organize new issues?

output_examples.input: That worked! The Docker build was failing because of the cache issue.
output: Prevention added: Pin base image versions, use docker system prune periodically

best_practices: Configure output directory early so docs go where your team can find them
Review patterns.md before making changes to avoid known issues
Add schema values when new categories or components are encountered
Link related solutions together using the frontmatter "related" field
anti_patterns: Skipping documentation for trivial fixes to avoid noise in the knowledge base
Creating duplicate docs instead of linking related solutions
Using vague symptoms that are hard to search later

faq.question: Does this skill execute code?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based documentation skill. It generates markdown files based on conversation context.

faq.question: Where are documents saved?
faq.answer: To a configurable output directory. The user or agent specifies this location when creating documentation.

faq.question: Can it search existing docs?
faq.answer: Yes using grep commands. The skill searches by keyword, file path, and component to find similar issues before creating new docs.

faq.question: Is data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All documentation stays local in the user's project directory. No network calls are made.

faq.question: What triggers auto-documentation?
faq.answer: Phrases like "that worked", "it's fixed", "working now", "problem solved", or the /compound command.

faq.question: How is this different from a wiki?
faq.answer: Documentation is created automatically from solved problems, ensuring fixes are captured while context is fresh. Pattern detection surfaces recurring issues.
